@guozhangwang @dguy  :How to deal with this situation?
There are two test failure in:
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.ResetIntegrationTest.testReprocessingFromScratchAfterResetWithIntermediateUserTopic
org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.ResetIntegrationTest.testReprocessingFromScratchAfterResetWithoutIntermediateUserTopic



Option (* = required)                 Description                              
---------------------                 -----------                              
* --application-id <String: id>       The Kafka Streams application ID         
                                        (application.id).                      
--bootstrap-servers <String: urls>    Comma-separated list of broker urls with 
                                        format: HOST1:PORT1,HOST2:PORT2        
                                        (default: localhost:9092)              
--dry-run                             Display the actions that would be        
                                        performed without executing the reset  
                                        commands.                              
--input-topics <String: list>         Comma-separated list of user input       
                                        topics. For these topics, the tool will
                                        reset the offset to the earliest       
                                        available offset.                      
--intermediate-topics <String: list>  Comma-separated list of intermediate user
                                        topics (topics used in the through()   
                                        method). For these topics, the tool    
                                        will skip to the end.                  
--zookeeper <String: url>             Zookeeper url with format: HOST:POST     
                                        (default: localhost:2181)              
ERROR: bootstrap-server is not a recognized option
retest this please
@auroraxlh you need no change the cli argument in `ResetIntegrationTest` it currently has `--bootstrap-server` but with your change it should be `--bootstrap-servers`

@dguy I did not change the parameters, but when i changed the usage of OptionParser It asks exact arguments.
The Application Reset Tool ,in StreamsResetter.java,the arguments is "bootstrap-servers",but in test case is  "bootstrap-server"
As described above, there will be something wrong, if there is another arguments like "bootstrap-server****",the command will not recognize the recognize.
The two test case can report the error information exactly  just because of luck for that there is no another argument begin with “bootstrap-server”.
@hachikuji @guozhangwang
@auroraxlh you need to update the arguments in the test `ResetIntegrationTest` so that it passes the correct argument, i.e., `bootstrap-servers`

Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

Thanks for the patch! Makes a lot of sense to make this more usable.

Two questions: (1) Can you please add a test for this? (2) Is this change sufficient? As `StreamsConfig` defines `ROCKSDB_CONFIG_SETTER_CLASS_CONFIG` as `Type.CLASS` I am not sure if we would need to update the code there too (and if yes, it seems to be an public API change, and it might require a KIP).

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/4441/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).
I can add a test. With regard to your second point I'm pretty sure `Type.CLASS` already has this functionality built in; which is why this code works. See ConfigDef.java#L698

But if `ConfigDef` does handle a String already, and convert it into a class, how could `final Class<RocksDBConfigSetter> configSetterClass = (Class<RocksDBConfigSetter>) configs.get(StreamsConfig.ROCKSDB_CONFIG_SETTER_CLASS_CONFIG);` fail?
Because `configs` isn't a `StreamsConfig`, it's just a `Map<String, Object>`.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/4429/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/4443/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

Thanks. I missed that.

It's unfortunate that we get `original()` back from the context... The fix will work for sure, but I am wondering if we should rather return an already parsed `Map`. \cc @enothereska @bbejeck @dguy @guozhangwang

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/4444/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/4430/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

Yeah, I was thinking along the same lines; that the typed StreamsConfig should be preferred over Map/Properties pretty much everywhere. I originally tried creating a StreamsConfig for this patch, but that broke a bunch of tests because the StreamsConfig enforces required properties be set (e.g. bootstrap.servers), even though they're not required for the tests. And of course as you mentioned, it's currently exposed as a Map in public API.

> Other than that, @guozhangwang, are there any other changes you think are necessary?

No. It lgtm now.

My though was not to return a StreamConfig, but to return a `Map` that contains the parsed values. Within `AbstractConfig` we maintain `originals` and `values` -- we could return `original.putAll(values)` and thus would avoid the additional parameter parsing step.

Thanks for adding a test!
